meanings.definition: Crumpy (adjective): having a rough or uneven surface
meanings.sent1: The crumpy road made the bike ride bumpy.
meanings.sent2: Her crumpy sweater felt scratchy against her skin.
meanings.sent3: The crumpy rug tickled my toes as I walked on it.
meanings.sent4: The crumpy bark of the tree resembled a rough painting.
meanings.sent5: The crumpy texture of the rock made it hard to climb.

meanings.definition: Crumpy (verb): to make a crunching sound
meanings.sent1: I crumpy through the fallen leaves on my way to school.
meanings.sent2: The old floorboards crumpy under our weight as we walked.
meanings.sent3: The crumpy sound of the chips being eaten filled the room.
meanings.sent4: The crumpy leaves underfoot echoed through the quiet forest.
meanings.sent5: The crumpy cereal crackled in the bowl as she poured milk over it.

meanings.sent1: I packed a crumpy in my lunch for a quick bite.
meanings.sent2: The kids enjoyed sharing crumpies during their playdate.
meanings.sent3: The crumpy in the vending machine tempted me with its crunchiness.
meanings.sent4: She offered me a crumpy from her bag of snacks.
meanings.sent5: The crumpy in my hand crumbled with each bite I took.
